definition: a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

pinyin: yu4 qi1 shou1 ru4 piao4 ju4

sentences.english: They will expect a career growth and a magnificent actualization of a number of projects.
sentences.chinese: 他們會預期到職業的成長，一些項目會漂亮的完成。

sentences.english: Your intended recipients will be able to unscramble it with ease.
sentences.chinese: 您預期的收件人將能夠輕鬆地解讀它。

sentences.english: And most brain-numbing of all, you have expectations about what other people expect of you.
sentences.chinese: 當腦子都麻木了，想想別人對你的預期。

sentences.english: New employees are undependable or do not perform to expectations.
sentences.chinese: 新來的員工不可靠，或表現的不如預期。

sentences.english: The new Asia-Pacific Hub is expected to be fully operational the first half of 2009.
sentences.chinese: 新的亞太集散中心預期在2009年上半年全面運營。

sentences.english: At present, China's commercial banks is also difficult to accurately estimate the expected loss of non-lending.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我國商業銀行還難以準確估算貸款非預期損失。

sentences.english: Contemplated share offerings, both initial public offerings and straightforward share issuances , are being put back on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 首次公開募股等各種預期中的股票發行也已經擱置。

sentences.english: Wall Street gains after a smaller-than-expected number of jobs lost and a surprise drop in the unemployment rate.
sentences.chinese: 小於預期的失業數和失業率的神奇下跌使美股上漲。

sentences.english: The air-jet yarn strength of these three kinds material has attained the anticipatory aim.
sentences.chinese: 上述三種原料噴氣紗的單紗強度均達到了預期的目標。

sentences.english: But the events have not caught the team unprepared.
sentences.chinese: 不過此次事件並沒有超出過渡小組的預期。

sentences.english: This time, the test passes as expected.
sentences.chinese: 這一次，與預期的一樣，測試通過了。

sentences.english: What is the expected cost to deliver the business benefit?
sentences.chinese: 達到這個商業利益所預期的成本是多少？

sentences.english: But Netease still cannot anticipate in the base oneself upon of enterprise mailbox market and development.
sentences.chinese: 但網易在企業郵箱市場的立足與發展仍然不可預期。

sentences.english: That puts the stock on a still-heady multiple of 23 times earnings.
sentences.chinese: 以這一股價折算的雅虎預期市盈率仍然高達23倍。

sentences.english: Honestly, this is easier than I expected, though the frequency of archaic and rare words is quite high.
sentences.chinese: 老實說，異體字和生僻字出現的頻率比我的預期高。

sentences.english: We foresee a soft landing, but this cannot be taken for granted.
sentences.chinese: 我們預期會出現軟着陸，但不能將其視爲理所當然。

definition: achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
